title: Role of ACCD Board of Directors
text:
Role of ACCD Board of Directors 0 comments 
Are you interested in helping to conserve natural resources in Adams County? If so, you might want to consider being nominated to serve on the Adams County Conservation District Board of Directors. 
In 1945, Act 217, the Conservation District Law, was passed, allowing the creation of county conservation districts. In 1947, a group of Adams County farmers petitioned the Adams County Commissioners and the Adams County Conservation District was created. Our mission is to "serve and assist the citizens of Adams County by promoting the maintenance, improvement and wise use of land, water and other related natural resources at the local level; to offer technical, financial and educational assistance to landowners in cooperation with local, state and federal agencies; and to provide sound conservation and natural resources management assistance in Adams County." kAmp 8@G6C?:?8 3@2C5 @7 D6G6?
